subject: p15896572
Findings: Frontal and lateral radiographs of the chest. There is no obvious lobar airspace consolidation. Increased perihilar opacities and interstitial markings are consistent with mild pulmonary edema. The heart size is minimally enlarged. There is no pneumothorax or pleural effusion. Although the patient is somewhat rotated, rightward deviation of the trachea is likely secondary to tortuous aorta. Marked kyphosis of the spine is unchanged. There is a stable moderate-large hiatal hernia.
